intro: Nematolepis rhytidophylla, commonly known as the rough-leafed fern, is a species of flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, rough-textured leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it an important component of New Zealand's native flora.
